info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:39AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rock Island, northeastern Mercer, northwestern Henry and southeastern Scott Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1238 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Moline, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Colona, Cleveland, Warner and Osborn around 1250 AM CDT. Orion around 1255 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Geneseo, Andover and Cambridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 300 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 29. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 280 between mile markers 9 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
